main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted north of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania on June 8, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as a flat, elongated, triangular-shaped object the size of a shirt button held at arm's length.
The object climbed steadily in a straight course for approximately 5 minutes, then hovered, moved backward, and disappeared.
The observer, a 38-year-old civilian technical illustrator, watched the object for around 15 minutes.
The weather conditions were mostly clear with a cloud cover of 2/10 and a ceiling of 12,000 feet.
The object was concluded to possibly be a balloon based on its description and flight characteristics.
